intro: Liatris × deamii f. albina, commonly known as the White Gayfeather, is a cultivar of the Gayfeather plant, characterized by its striking white flower spikes. It is a hybrid species within the Asteraceae family, known for its tall, slender stems and showy inflorescences. The plant typically grows in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained soils. It is valued in gardens for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators like butterflies and bees. This cultivar is often used in native plant gardens due to its adaptability and aesthetic value.
